review: It was good i ordered a chicken salad it was about 9 something and the pieces of chicken were pretty huge the server was a little laggy though but overall it was okay

I love Red Robin and when they opened up this location a few years back I was really happy I had one nearby.  The burgers are delicious.  I always vacillate between the bacon cheeseburger with pepper jack and some pink in the middle and their awesome Cod (Fish and chips).  The fish and chips are phenomenal and I think if they didn't have really great burgers I would still come here just for the Cod. They also have bottomless steak fries. How can you go wrong with that?  I've always had really good service here and during the holidays they have a killer gingerbread shake.  Oh yeah, and they also serve alcoholic beverages.  How can it get any better?  They usually have some sport on the several TVs they have around the place and it's pretty loud and kid friendly.  Today my sister and I had a starter of fried jalapeno coins and zucchini and they were both great.  Red Robin is always a good idea.

I came here with a group of coworkers after a short day at work. It was around 11:30 in the afternoon and only two other tables were being occupied. There was one waitress on duty and she came over promptly to take our drink orders. The one thing I like about Red Robin is that they offer free refills on some of their specialty nonalcoholic beverages. I ordered a Freckled Lemonade which is their strawberry lemonade. It comes with real strawberries at the bottom and top of the glass. For food I got a traditional bacon cheeseburger. All their burgers, wraps and sandwiches comes with unlimited fries. I love sprinkling the Red Robin seasoning on my fries, gives them a little extra flavor. Nothing special about it so nothing more to say. The reason why I knocked off the star was because the waitress was kinda obnoxious. We wanted to have a relaxing lunch after work and socialize. Unfortunately, we felt like the waitress was rushing us out. She put the bill on our table right after we ordered food, we hadn't even received the food yet! She then picked up the bill holder twice when we hadn't put our cards in it to pay. She stood off to the side staring down the three tables that were occupied. We couldn't understand her need to try and force is out, it wasn't busy so they weren't in need of the tables. They have a frequent customer card where you get a free appetizer when you register the card. I haven't registered mine yet but I like getting cards like this so I can see what type of rewards I can earn.

Joined their Royalty Club, so we went here for my birthday : ) (free burger). Been here a few times before, so l was expecting awesomeness. What we got was not so much.    The service here is always (always) spectacular. We were seated in like 5 minutes, looked over our menus and placed our orders within 10 minutes. Ended up ordering a whiskey cheeseburger, a chicken sandwich and a bacon cheeseburger (along with a Coke).     Got our food in like 10 minutes! The waiter kindly split my mom's chicken sandwich and my burger. So we shared our food~ best of both worlds. My nephew chowed down on his, and got a second order of fries. I at my 1/2 burger and got a second order of fries (ended up taking 1/2 of chicken sandwich home along with most of my fries). My mom ate hers there.     The burger tasted like nothing, l mean nada. Bland, bland, bland!!! The whole cheeseburger was flavorless. It desperately needed their seasoned salt. Needless to say, we were disappointed. The "crispy" onion straws were stringy, unedible slimy, soggy things that would hang out of the corner of your mouth.     The chicken sandwich at least had some  flavor, but nothing to rave about. It was tender chicken, not dried out at all~ so that was good(?).    The fries... Ahhh the fries. I picked on up from my basket (when they bring you your order the burgers placed on a bed of fries (like 9 fries, no joke) to keep them warm). Half of it was raw. Other than that the rest were edible. But they were ALL soggy. Like, pick one up and it bends all the way to your finger soggy. Now, l'm a fan of soggy fries, but this was kinda ridiculous! But were were starving, so.... I did take the rest of them home, and later fried them in a pan (l know), added a little salt, and they were pretty yummy.    Our waiter was pretty cool, though. My nephew got a Coke to go, cause their root beer was ucky, and we were brought an xl Coke : )    Just hoping this was a rare experience~ we'll give it another try, someday
Red Robin Yumm !! Nuff said , loved the Octoberfest burger hope they bring it back again this year !!

This was my first time going to a red robin, and i loved the atmosphere.  The decor was very nice and the place was spotless, and my server was top-knotch!  However, the food was HORRIBLE.  I ordered a Burnin Hot Jalapeno Burger, and the fried jalapenos inside were soggy and disgusting.  This burger was just horrible, and the meat was the size of a Mcdonalds cheeseburger patty. SO SMALL!  I would prefer IN N Out to this ANYTIME, and for a fraction of the price! The Sweet Potato Fries were warm, and lacking flavor as well.  The garlic fries were okay, but it felt like I had paid $10 for a buffet of fries..seriously. LOL  However, our server were great and attentive and even offered some more buffet fries in a to-go box..lol.  I miiighht come back and try again..maybe the chef was just a really crappy chef.., ONLY because our server was so warm and welcoming.  But the burger tasted so bad, that i took the whole burger home and ended up eating fries for dinner..I gave the burger to my dog when i got home..at least HE liked it..lol

have come here a few times. food is great. the fish and chips are incredible. i cant believe how good they are. high quality food. the jalapeno burger was great. i ordered their apple pie bits and those were good. my friend ordered a burger and they burned his bun from the inside. he didn't realize it till a few bites cause it tasted burnt somehow. the manager gave him a whole new burger and gave him 50% off the burger as well. small concern but i felt it got handled the right way.  i like the way they bring the condiments to the table so that when your food arrives you have verything there.

Yay for bottomless fries and drinks! :)   This Red Robin's peppercorn burger wasn't as juicy and delicious as the first time hubby and I got it at the Arcadia branch.  But the burger is still huge and shareable.  Plus, you get bottomless fries!

Good food for the price.  Quick service and kid's menu has many options.  My family comes here frequently ( once a week) and we have never had an unpleasant experience to date.   Great place for families with kids.

I had lunch with a friend and the food was really good, we shared the wings and i have to say i am fan! My friend had a caesar chicken wrap with a side of soup and it looked great and i had a Guacamole bacon burger and it was delicious, it was juicy and full of flavor and the fries were awesome! The place was clean, the service was a bit slow but overall i can say this place is great.

Nice place to grab a quick bite! The service is always good (FYI their male servers are the best.) Kid friendly and drinks are good. Not a big variety in their menu but it has a few choices other than burgers. Their salads are pretty good. So if you're in town & looking for a place where you'll get good food, drinks and service, red robins is the place for you(;

It seems to me that $15 for lunch for one is a bit extreme especially in these troubled economic times. It could be argued that the fries were all "you can eat" but they were soggy and never once did the server offer me more.

I like the Arcadia location better. I felt like the food wasn't as great here. :(  Good customer service but the food. Eh. I had the sauteed shroom with a veggie burger. It really needed some flavor. Like sauce or something. I couldn't put my finger on it but it was really bland. And the paper of the burger stuck to the cheese so I think I got more fiber than intended in my meal.   What really disappointed me were the fries. They were so pasty and dry. Different from the fries at the Arcadia location. Maybe they were old or not stored right but blah. Gross.

Had dinner here last night food was so-so had to wait 15 minutes to be seated and as they are taking us to our booth I see at least 6 empty tables really made me wonder (no we didn't request booth only). Once seated we ordered and had another wait of more than 30 minutes for our food. My wife ordered the Mac & Cheese it was down right awful boiled elbow noodles with a small amount of cheese melted on top zero flavor. I had the Chicken wrap and it was Ok but over $10 not worth that kind of money more in the $7-$8  range would be more approporiate. Don't think we will return
When the bounties are low and so are my credits, the Tavern Double is always the pick! Keep them unlimited fries coming!!

This place is hands down the greatest burger joint I've ever visited. I've been to other Red Robin locations and this one is my favorite. The restaurant is clean, the service is quick and the waiters make you feel welcomed. The Whiskey River BBQ burger is my favorite item off the menu and i recommend it. And endless fries? What can go wrong there?

My server was sweet, and somewhat attentive.  The host kinda creeped me out & was just too much. He tried to up-sell some promotional dinner item before I was even through the first of the set of doors. Kinda tacky.  The food wasn't that great. Just seemed like a thawed out patty on a bun that came out of a bag of 12. The lettuce was wilted too. Feels like they're trying to do too much w/ the "upscale" feel.  I liked the old Red Robin better.  The environment and even the employees just seemed, HAPPIER!

Ate here at the whittwood mall location........April is the best server, the best waitress here!!   I say this..Service will make or break you meal....April makes my visit worth while every time. The restaurant industry needs more servers like you!!

Excellent customer service and food!  Last time I placed order to go they forgot my pita bread and didn't chop my Avo-Cobb salad. I called to complain because I hate having to return to a restaurant for a mistake on their part.  The manager quickly apologized and asked for my address.  I didn't expect $20 and an apology letter.  Way to go!!!  This is exactly how you keep customers loyal!

I've been here many times before, lunch dates with my husband or with friends, family dinners even on school or team fundraiser nights and the food has always been great. Usually I will order the chicken Caesar wrap and split it with the hubby (after going through a time of always ordering the crispy cod sandwich!) and the kids know their favorites by heart as well. The service is usually pretty good although sometimes a little slow depending on the server but always friendly.    Today it was just me by myself for lunch and I decided to call in an order to go. I've had the crispy chicken tender salad before and knowing how good it was yet also how BIG I decided on a small portion instead. I was not disappointed, customer service over the phone was great, the food was ready for pick up when they said it would be and it was just as tasty as I remembered it from when I ordered it last. Nice job Red Robin, I'm not a girl that will easily go to lunch or dinner alone, but you will not lose my order just because I don't happen to have a date for the day ;-)

Ok.. so we have been coming here for years and lately the food has turn to CRAP! I don't know who the hell is cooking over there. The food is so nasty! I ordered a burger and the grease was dripping everywhere. The bun was soak in grease. Complained and got something different. I ordered the Cod Fish and the Cod fish was frozen in the middle of it. Gave it back to them and just ordered the clam chowder soup and it was cold it still had the uncooked lumps. Gross just totally grossed out. But my little one like to eat there. So I just thought maybe the cook just sucked that day. We went back got take out my little one got a cheeseburger and I got wings. OMG! the meat was dripping in blood and my wings were DUMP IN SALT! It was like if someone open a salt jar and pour it all over the wings. What is going on in there. I ordered the food late last night so we couldn't return the food back to them. We are done! We are not going back! We are taking our business some place else....
FREE BIRTHDAY BURGER when you sign up for their loyalty club!!! Kym gave us great service tonight!

Took my family for dinner here at Red Robin.  I've been here many times before, different locations as well.  Anyway, my reason for writing this review is to report how small this Whiskey river bbq burger.  I wasn't expecting a kids meal.  Honestly, this burger is smaller than the Carl's Jr 6 dollar burger.  I asked my server if the burger size has changed.  She said no.   This will be the last time I go to red robin to dine.  The burger is bite sized and they expect you to get full from the bottomless fries that also come out in a small portion but you have to ask for refills.  Besides the food not being of value, our server did a great job, so i had no issues with the service.  As far as food, next time i'm going to G Burger in La Habra.  Angus burger at a great price.  Hope Red Robin values my review and changes their burger size back to the way it use to be, a real burger, not a Mc Double sized burger.

We love coming here.  The wait is never too long.  I think it was a full afternoon and they still seated us 15 minutes later which was great because my feet were killing me from work all day. The food always comes out the same. Delicious!!! Yum!
Burgers and shakes are the way to go here love love it!! My fav place to come and eat when I am indecisive

I and my family have been coming to this Red Robin for some time now. Went and had dinner there maybe for the 30th time since the place was constructed. Now I believe most Red Robins are all the same in every aspect but for some reason this is the one we come to all the time and we have I think maybe five of them in driving distance. The customer service has always been good here; I have yet to have bad service at this location. All the waitresses have always been good and they do a great job of keeping your glass full along with checking up on you. Tonight we had Karla who did her best to keep up with a good size crowd of people around keeping us happy and been there when we needed her. I had the new Smoke and Pepper burger which is the bomb a must try (got it cooked medium) really tasty full flavored of course with their signature stake fries and a Dr. Pepper. The rest of the gang got some of the old american classics. We did get an appetizer which is one of the popular ones. The Onion Ring Tower which was ok a little to oily and the onions in side the batter were tough each one you bit into the whole piece of  onion would come out and all that was left was the oily battered crust. I have had other things from their menu as well over the years and like I said I have never had a bad meal at this location. The one thing that was a little upsetting is that all the locations have tried to dump anything that is kid friendly such as the Red Robin that would come out and visit the customers and giving the kids balloons. Not saying this venue is not for kids just saying that it is one of the things that all the kids liked that Red Robin dose not do anymore because every time I go I see lots of parents with their kids with them and they seem to be having a good time with their family. I know this is a small thing and of course they have a full bar and a couple TVs with all sorts of sports going on so yea I could see why they are going the sports bar rout. So what I am saying here is that if you want some tasty food, good service and entertainment with a good social surrounding atmosphere then this Red Robin is for you. So All the little birdies on Jaybird Street Love to hear the robin go tweet tweet tweet.

Came here on Saturday night on a dinner date with my gf the wait was 20 mins so we waited for a table because we both have been craving a good burger our food was really good we was both happy with our order But we both didn't get served a lot frys but overall the burgers well served the only issue we had was sitting area they sat us down by the serving line where the workers are waiting for the orders come out  it's like I rather sit in kitchen because that how I felt sitting their couldn't have a talk with gf over sitting their but overall I give the food a b- sitting área D+
Worst service ever... family member ordered a salad and the host didnt even give a fork... waited for ever for napkins , knife was dirty

The food was good as usual but i have to give them 2 stars because their customer service was terrible.  We waited about 30mins for our food because our waitress had gone on her break and her relief had gotten confused, well at least that is what she said.
Came in for a simple fish sandwich.... 1/2 hour later still waiting.  No excuses and the plain ice tea had a weird taste.  What is happening to these restaurants????  2 stars maybe!
Damn you Red Robbin, now I can NEVER have another burger from a regular fast food joint without being disappointed. Great food, good service and endless steak fries. You can't go wrong!

So I go to dinner with my twin lol aka co worker Veronica Singh were gossiping and eating and out of no where she sees a fly in her salad I looked it was big as day we tell the manager here reply is something on the lines of were lying saying she didn't see anything we looked at her and was speechless we have no reason to lie, we were not trying to get a free meal we are both single hard working moms and that manager was very rude with that said don't visit the RED ROBIN IN WHITTIER!!!!!

I dont usually post reviews on anything,  its not something I enjoy but today was different...my friends and i stop by red robins before heading back home..red's is one  of our favorites places to eat any time...we got seated quick and the wait wasnt long for a table...but once we were seated everything went down hill.. it only took our server David  only 15 min to come to our table and ask us what would we like to drink. And another 5 to bring our simple drinks to our table (none alcohol)....lets not even talk about our food....he brought out our dinner and left. No enjoy or nada.  To top it off he didnt bring us any napkins we had to asked for them after been eating for a while ..maybe he was having a bad day, who knows,  we dont know... but regardless he should try to smile at least once in a while and show a friendly side.  So David ,my boy try to get to the customer quick if u want ur tip to be bigger or if u want any tips for that matter ;)

The servers are very nice.  Avoid lunch time though.  It gets crowded.  And try to avoid this place around 3:00-4:00, if you don't want to listen to the high school kids' drama and gossip.  It can get loud.  The burgers are tasty though.  It's our go to place on Fridays when we're too tired from work and too lazy to cook at home.

Smiling faces and warm greetings throughout the store.  Food was ok but not quite the type of burgers and fries I remembered from way back when.. I had the double red tavern burger and it was good but somehow just tasted as if I had gone to Wendys.  I am making an assumption but it was almost like the burgers were pre-packaged frozen patties from the super market.  Sweet potato fries were still good as I remembered but somehow this place seems to have lost its shimmer against the gourmet burger restaurants that seem to be popping up everywhere.

I went to Red Robin with my husband and two friends. They ordered cheeseburgers I ordered a barbecue chicken salad. After 40 minutes the cheeseburgers came out they were all cold and the French fries were soggy. Finally my salad came out missing the avocado the black beans and it had green bell peppers on it. Green bell peppers really, I've ordered the salad many times and it never came with green bell peppers nor does it state on the menu that it comes with green bell pepper. I told her, the waitress, and she looks just blank as a piece of paper. After 45 minutes waiting for a salad , I asked her to take it back and take the item off my check. My friend was going to send her hamburger back but the waitress said it would be another 20 minutes, now keep in mind the restaurant is not busy. We asked for the manager he came over all sweaty and said there was a problem but we didn't need to know about it. So she wound up not eating either. The boys they don't care they eat anything. Then she comes back with a side order of avocado?? No salad just avocado. Needless to say we won't be back, this isn't the first time I've had bad luck at this Red Robin. I think it's a dumping ground 4 training managers. I've had this experience before and this is the last time.

Awesome place for an awesome time. Went in to celebrate my brothers graduation and ending up having the best time with our server and food. If you have the chance try the Colossus Burger you won't regret it!

First of all I am a fan of Red Robin.  However, the longer the location has been open the worse the service has become. I can relate to nearly all the low reviews already posted. The food is also hit and miss.

Try the strawberry lemonade, it's probably one of the best I've had and the bottomless steak fries are always good and amazing. Anyway good place to get some lunch with your friends (or family if that's who happens to be around) so check it out.

We have been here about 5 times and this has been the best one out of the other locations closest to us. However, they still lack some customer service, the hostess doesn't greet when we arrive they just quickly ask for "how many" and give us a wait time and they don't smile. On our most recent visit, our appetizer kept going to the wrong tables. Once our food arrived they served what looked like 7 fries, making the plate look like an appetizer itself. When we asked for more fries, they never came.  The visit prior to that, we ordered what seemed like double chocolate milkshake, looked really chunky in the picture but when we got it, it was just a chocolate milk shake with a bit of crushed Oreos on the side :/ We can say we love the food but the service isn't that great.

First time at this location. Came here on a Sunday evening. We had to wait about five minutes. The hostess noted on their iPad. Michelle was our server. She was nice and friendly. She got us our drinks first. When she took our order the first time, I noticed she did not note it down. I told my girlfriend that I will rate this place five stars if she gets it right. Moments later she came back with an order pad and double-checked what we ordered. So much for that fifth star. What made the night more noisier is that a Yonsei basketball team with their parents took almost one complete section of the restaurant. There are three sections from what I can remember. Then service suffered from that point on. Eventually we got our food. My burger and fries tasted great. It took longer to get a wait staff attention to get the bill and get our card back, but that was expected due to the circumstances that night.

Food was on point, cant same the same for the service, took about 20 min to get anyone to even acknowledge we were seating, once the order was placed we had to flag down the waitress for refills, wasnt so happy about that....

Try there knew colossus burger it's really good with there fat fries our wait was only five minutes our waiter was friendly and over all it was great. I was very impressed with the quality of service they provided.

I usually have a great experience at Red Robin but this time was not too good. Our server was attentive enough I suppose. My group sat in the bar area. Once we ordered our drinks, it took awhile for them to finally reach our table. I sat there staring at them across the way for awhile before our waitress noticed they were done. Our meal was satisfactory except for the fact that my husband's burger was wrong. He ordered a bacon cheeseburger and when it arrived it had everything but the bacon. The waitress didn't apologize and just said that she'll bring out bacon on the side for him. Really?  We all had seperate bills and once we got them, they were completely jumbled up, probably because the waitress didn't bother writing our orders down and did it off the top of her head. Beside being jumbled up, she charged mine and my husband's bill wrong ie she charged us for three burgers instead of two. We had to have another waitress fix this. Bottom line: Red Robin is usually always a great place to eat but this time it wasn't good.
What can I say.. it's Red Robin and the food is always amazing. The hostesses and waitress are not good though
My husband and I ate here last night. Great burger, delicious tortilla soup and good service!

Gonna make it simple. Here is a list of horrible shit at our visit. 1. Sticky tables 2.dirty sticky menus [could see liquid of some sort all over menus] 3.slow service. We never saw the waitress after she took the order.  4. Nasty shit all over counter above our food and drinks. 5. Sticky booth seats. 6. served ice cold fries.  7. Chicken wrap was chewy and hard to eat. 8. [Fish n chips] fish was soaked in scalding hot oil but one piece of fish was still under cooked and cold in the center. We tried to leave promptly but it took 15 min for the waitress to come pick up the check. We left hungry, disgusted, and wanting to never return. We went to get a proper lunch at a near by pizza eatery where food is fresh and service is good.
Horrible service! We never got a refill in our drinks or the "bottomless" fries after asking twice! NO tip!

Worst red robin any where. The server was horrible got the order wrong and had to come back three times are ask us the order again. After waiting 45 min we were starving. We watching two managers eat the while time. Finally called a server over to get a manager. Neither of them wanted to leave their food and come over. When one did he was an angry jerk. He was very rude and it seemed sexist. We ended up leaving with out eating.

Came here a couple of times always good food service really depend on the day and who you get ! I got the delight chicken sandwich which I really liked and I like how it came with all the topping on the side! I don't like when they pound on all the toppings! Will be back

The last time I was at Red Robin it was shortly after they had opened and it was so disorganized and LOUD that I swore to never go back. When a friend suggested we meet here for lunch I was hesitant but agreed. It was so different during the lunch hour. Our waitress - who doubled as bartender - was accommodating and very understanding when we weren't ready to order the first three times she approached. Once we placed our order though, she became a bit more distracted (not a complaint) as more clients were seated and ordering drinks. I had the Red Double Cheeseburger (or something) and it was very good. I asked that it be cooked medium but it was a little more on the well side; that was okay. My friend had a fish sandwich and declared it delicious. I may need to reconsider my previous ban on Red Robin.

Ive come to this spot several times, and the food and drinks are always good! The servers are kind and Ive never had a problem getting their attention, or had issues with slow service. Decent selection of beers and mixed drinks, better than most restaurants of this caliber.
Great food with great employees!  There have been a handful of times when I've gone and the service has been slow, but other than that, I truly enjoy this place!

One star and I am being nice. The food was horrible and cold. The server asked which plate was whose and we answered,........ And she still gave me the wrong plate. We had no utensils or napkins. When the server finally asked if we needed anything we asked for napkins but nothing was brought to use until 15minutes later. Very very very very horrible service. As I am writing this I am still waiting for my card. Last time I come here. This is horrible.

We stopped in for lunch at the Red Robin restaurant in Whittier. Red Robin is a chain restaurant that is popular for their fire-grilled burgers. The first thing you notice as you enter is the large life like Statue of Liberty and on the torch she is holding up a hamburger. The decor has many American items of memorabilia placed throughout the restaurant. They have a full menu of appetizers, soups, salads, sandwiches, desserts and a kids menu, but their specialty is their crazy variety of gourmet burgers made from beef, chicken, turkey and vegan styles. All come with all-you-can-eat french fries. I ordered the Royal Red Robin Burger ($10.79) topped with a fried sunny-side-up egg and a side of onion rings. My wife ordered the Red's Tavern Double Burger ($6.99) with two beef patties, melted cheese, tomato, lettuce and fries. The burgers were cooked perfectly and we truly enjoyed them. The fried egg added a delightful rich taste to my burger. We ended on a sweet note by sharing a Mountain High Mudd Pie ($5.99). An avalanche of chocolate and vanilla ice cream layered with OREO cookie crust, fudge and caramel, topped with whipped cream and cherries. Simply put, it was sinfully delicious!  Two thumbs up for a friendly family place to have an unforgettable delicious burger.

I was totally craving a teriyaki burger and off to Red Robin I go.  Got a seat right away in the bar, ordered my food and drinks and within 10 minutes I had everything in front of me, prepared right and deliciously.  I never had an empty glass or want for anything.  The manager Noel, even stopped by my table twice to make sure the food was great.  An excellent job by everyone involved.  I just wish other places were this good.  Thank you for a job well done!

Being a self-proclaimed hamburger aficionado, I have to give a fair review of Red Robin after years of coming here to partake in their burger goodness. Honestly, it's just average. I've had my share of positive and negative experiences here, and they sort of balance each other out. The service here has always kind of been an issue. Most of the time, I've noticed that the servers here seem to be stretched a little thin and it really affects the quality of service that you get. It's happened on several occasions where we ask for our food with some kind of modification (e.g., no tomatoes) and it doesn't come like we asked. A little more attention to detail from the kitchen would be nice. The food as a whole is pretty average. This might be a personal preference, but I find that getting your burger as a double (with the smaller patties) just tastes so much better than the larger patties that they offer. But again, aside from some of the more elaborate offerings, there's nothing here that feels unique, that you can get somewhere else. You have to give them credit though, having endless fries (and other select sides) is a win-win situation.

Awesome server, great service and attention from her. Kept my drink consistently filled. Ordered a appetizer that was awesome, (forgot the name of it, but it was a French onion dip n chip). Ordered a bleu cheese gourmet burger to share with the girlfriend. Perfect amount of food to be satisfied for two. Only issue I had was my plate had stains/grease/residual from previous use.  Waitress was informed, she took proper action. The manager presented herself in a professional manner and took care of the issue.  Great food, fun atmosphere, great service with a good smile. Tipped her well because she did great, the plate not so much. If I go back is only hope to get the same waitress.

Red Robin....yum!! I love to eat here when we get a chance on the weekend. This is located in the Whittwood town center next to JCPennys.  I would have given 5 stars a couple months ago but they have been changing so many things that I used to love.  For starters my daughter's love their mac n cheese they had. It was one of the best mac n cheese I have tasted as well. They would also be able to get free refills and take one home as well. It was awesome. Then one day about a month ago I would say we went and they changed their whole kids menu. They no longer served their delicious mac n cheese. It was now Kraft mac n cheese. Really!? I can buy a whole box of that for a dollar. I hate when restaurants serve Kraft.  She was really sad because that's what she always looked forward too. Another thing they stopped doing was having balloons at the front to give to the kids. At first when we noticed that we asked and they said they don't do it anymore. Then another time we saw a kid with one. Now you just have to ask and they get them in the back which takes a while. So what I love about this place is their food. Everything I have always comes out delicious.  I love the burgers,  sandwiches,  and especially the chicken tortilla soup.  The bottomless fries are so yummy! Normally burn my finger when I eat them but it's worth it!  Always add their seasoning,  great flavor!  I also use their rewards card where you get a free burger after 10 meals.

Service was slow and terrible, we sat at the bar and had too wait until the two bartenders finished their conversation. The greeter came and cleaned our table. Table was sticky even after the cleaning (dirty rags). I ordered the bottomless fruit and got bottomless apples. Maybe there was a fruit shortage that day. My wife counted the number of fries on her little cup and there was about 8-10. The bartender's attitude was almost as if we were bothering her.

Dined at this Red Robin tonight and I have to say, the service was ABSOLUTELY TERRIBLE. AWFUL. After being seated, the waitress (Roxanne) quickly rushed to our table asking for our drink and appetizer orders. After asking for two lemonades and an Oreo milkshake, as well as an order of bottomless fries to start off our meal, Roxanne arrived a few minutes later with only a single lemonade and a water (which we did not ask for). After that incident, we only saw Roxanne TWO more times for the remainder of our visit. The Oreo milkshake did not arrive for HALF AN HOUR.  The milkshake was not even served to us by our waitress, Roxanne. About five minutes later, Roxanne returned to our table and proceeded to take our order after we waited over half an hour. The Oreo milkshake turned out to be warm and melted and we were not helped by any employee for another 10-15 minutes. Finally, a server named Juan, who had witnessed that we were unhappy, ventured over from his section to ask us if we needed anything. We told him that after 45 MINUTES, we had not received the lemonade that we ordered shortly after we arrived and asked him if we could speak to a manager. Juan quickly fetched us the manager, a manager who promised he would make the rest of our experience a "perfect evening". After speaking to the manager, who returned only once after his initial visit, our food was served to us almost 45 minutes after we had ordered it. The food was the only decent part of our visit. Good quality and the order was correct. Juan, being a fantastic server return multiple times, even though he was not our own waiter. Our actual waitress, Roxanne, returned only once more, just to give us the check.  We received horrible service both from our waitress and the manager, who did not once offer any sort of discount or comp. any item we had been waiting for. As we left the restaurant, we were followed out by the manager who proceeded to offer us a coupon for an appetizer, which turned out to be EXPIRED.  Our experience was absolutely HORRID. The only reason I have rated this restaurant 2 stars instead of 1, is for Juan, who is obviously an experienced server who was both kind, polite, and generous, although he was not our waiter.  If you decide to visit this atrocious "establishment", please ensure that you are helped by Juan and avoid Roxanne at ALL COSTS.

Awesome burgers and chicken sandwiches. Onion ring stack is a great appetizer. Good and fun atmosphere. However, their dinner salads suck. My wife loves to get dinner salads with chicken etc. Red Robin makes teeny tiny salads with like no lettuce. What the heck this is the person's dinner....like in all they are going to eat. Now instead of asking for Red Robin she says take me to Wendy's cause the apple pecan salad there is way better than the overpriced weak salad at Red Robin. I also do not like that they want me to pay at the iPad type thing at the table. I asked about dessert and he said it is on their and pointed to it Red Robin Pad. What the heck? This is a restaurant not a vending machine. The service is getting worse too.

A great burger joint that gives Buffalo Wild Wings a run for its money. With great food, great staff, and a great drink menu, the only thing stopping this location from having 5-stars is the fact thAt it's a chain. 3/5

Red Robin. Not so yummmm. The california burger was okay but how do you under cook chicken? And they brought me 4 little fries. It's actually really disappointing because the manager brought our food. He obviously doesn't care about the quality coming out of his kitchen. And to order more fries, order them in the beginning because by the time our server came we were both done and ready for the check.

Delicious burgers and fries. The waitress at the bar was awesome; she kept checking up on us, didn't let the glass go empty, kept the fries coming. If you aren't into kids screaming I would highly suggest to sit at the bar. The televisions were a little loud but ehhh it's the bar and people get excited with the games.

We shared the bbq chicken wrap and a southwestern chicken salad! We had bottomless fries and it was delicious! Our server Natalie was very attentive and brought all the sauces we asked for and refills without having to ask her for one! We just moved a few blocks down and we will definitely be coming here!! And bottomless fries you just can't go wrong with that!! :)

Been here a couple of times and went back because 1. I was craving it and 2. Because I had a gift card. Walked in and grabbed a table at the bar. The waitresses/bartenders were very nice, friendly and very attentive. We ordered drinks while looking over the menu. We ordered boneless buffalo wings to start then placed our order. I ordered the royal red Robin burger that was cooked perfectly with a nice runny egg. My fiancee had a chicken wrap with dressing on the side. The only problem with both orders were the fries. The fries were cold and tasted a little soggy like they've been sitting there for a while. So we asked for a new batch and sure enough the next order were hot and fresh. Will be going back but next time will make sure to ask for freshly made fries.

A little over a week ago we went to RR in West Covina and had a bad experience. We had ordered bottomless fries before our meal and they said they don't do that anymore, we spoke with management and he said they don't honor that anymore and this new policy came from corporate. I received a reply today on Yelp from RR stating that policy isn't true.  So today we are at RR in Whittier and hands down we had such a GREAT experience! David G.our server is on his "A" game, he's polite, fast and very friendly ... service with a smile! And we got our bottomless fries before our meal :) Way to go David G.!!!
.I love there customer service .store is very clean and neat.food is grate .I love every thing about them

Rarely come to this Red Robin, and I live locally. I love Red Robin, but not this location. I would rather go to West Covina's location.  I'm giving this place three stars because  1. Our waitress seemed to be on autopilot and would seem to run through our orders. I mean she would table touch, but it would take her a while to come back with our request (and no, it wasn't busy in the restaurant).  2. The portion size, particularly with the bottomless fries, was small. In West Co. you would receive a basket, but here it felt like it was less than a handful.  3. Sticky menus and slippery floors. The menus felt dirty. Yeah, yeah that's an OCD thing, but hey I'm not gonna eat a hamburger after touching something sticky.   This place still gets 3 stars because I enjoyed my food overall, it was all very delicious. But like I said, I would rather go to West Co than this one.
Always the go to spot ... Decor has changed and I'm trying to adapt... Otherwise still yummy and super friendly service ...

On several occasions I have gotten food to go from this location, Each time I have to wait for a server to assist which takes so long it might be quicker to get a table and order that way. Most time I have to ask at least twice for somebody to take my order.  Overall not very 'to-go' friendly But to be fair, I have dined in and they do have very good customer service.

If you like your food served to you cold then this is the place for you. I watched my order sit under the heat lamp for 10 minutes before it was served to me as soon as I bit into the fry it was cold and limp. I politely asked for my food to be remade. The waitress responded saying okay, but my warm food never came. I left having only eaten one fry and half of my sandwich. I'm never returning. Go to 5 Guys before thinking of going here.

Such a disappointing restaurant Im not sure why I still keep coming back to this place. I guess its because some friends and family just love eating the crap here. Overall my experiences have been neutral to just pathetic. So let me just share my last experience.. Came in, took almost 45 mins to get seated on a day that wasnt even that busy to begin with. Ordered our food and took almost ANOTHER 40 mins for a burger and if I remember correctly a chicken salad for my girl. Now here is how I am as a person, no matter how hungry I am, I will still eat the food provided to me because I cant bother arguing with a waiter who prolly hates their job to send food back cold to prolly either A) spit in my new redone food B) take even longer to cook up a new batch of food. My burger was so cold that Im surprised it wasnt sitting on a bed of ice cubes than a heat lamp, the gf's salad was mediocre considering it was lettuce n chicken. Of course my tip, if there was even one justified my satisfaction this place. I dont know why the Whitwood mall has such crappy restaurants, but Im guessing its because all the employees go to the same High School. I will do my best to not come back here ever again,even under recommendations.

Red Robin is singularly awesome when it comes to food allergies. I had no idea, but our fantastic server Ricco let me know that you can go online, and check out their allergy menu- updated weekly to tell you what's safe. You can call, and the manager will print it out for you. When you let them know you have a food allergy, they put out an allergy alert and notify everyone who is going to handle your food to use the special protocol. Me? Deathly allergic to onion. I ordered a vegan patty, and then our server came back and notified me there is onion in the patty itself, how badass is that? They let me know what sauces I could have, etc. seriously class act with food allergies. I'd come back for that alone, but fortunately the food is also really good!

Last time I was here didn't go well but i came back finally and I'm very happy I did the new menu is awesome our waitress Megan was great happy and everything we asked for was given never an empty drink either we had the California chicken sandwich which was great and the guac bacon burger it was perfect as well and it is very hard to beat bottomless French fries. I'll be back

Ok last time I will ever come here. Please read my experience.  I wouldn't be writing this if it wasn't so bad.. My husband and I came to this location once before and service was great, and honestly we couldn't even believe how bad it has gotten. I'm giving one place one star mainly for the store decorations. It looks so nice in there.  Ok first off our server was not attentive whatsoever we had to ask every time if we needed a refill I also had to ask other servers because ours was cleaning her tables ready to go home, while we had just gotten our food.  Ok second I understand that all the prices are in the menu but when my husband asks for the sides that come with the dish please do not trick us in ordering something that cost almost 2 dollars more. . Not to mention we only got 4 pieces of onion rings and we never got our " bottomless fries.And then tell us " oh you guys didn't know it was extra?.  And "it's on the menu" but honestly I can't remember much of the conversation because she talked over me for most of it. I have a lot of experience in the business too know that you do not argue with the customer. But in this case the customer was wrong. Like I said I usually wouldn't do this  because I understand the struggle but we were her only table.

Came with my wife and my mother in law for lunch. As my mother in law started eating her food ,she found a hair in her salad. We told the server and the manager came out and apologized. Gave us fries and new food. But when the bill came they still charged us the food with the hair in it. Unbelievable!!!
Server was great food was good. Even on a limited diet (only m-f) I was able to find something on the lighter/healthier side. The Ensenada chicken platter one breast no dressing was perfect.

Really dissatisfied with the hostesses. They said the wait would be 30 minutes and because we needed a high chair for my table we were forced to wait longer and watched everyone who came in after us get seated! There was no courtesy in letting us know she gave away our table because of a measly high chair when we could have done without one.
Great wings! Aimee at the bar is one of the best that has ever served me!!! All I ask is for good service and that they remember me. Aimee does both!!

Walked in and nobody at that hostess desk, I had to walk into the kitchen to ask if somebody could seat us. We ordered the chili Con queso dip and it was cold and had to ask for it to be returned &taken off the bill. The silverware was dirty... it literally had a fresh avocado chunk left on it as if they thought the previous customer didn't use it so instead of placing in the dirty dishes from the previous table they just reused it for the next table! ABSOLUTELY DISGUSTING! server was nice but that's all!

I've been to other red Robbins and i loved  them, this Whittier location is the worst don't  waste your money. Bottomless fries, haha jokes on you! They give  you a puny amt to start and seeing your waitress again is like wheres waldo? Never saw her again till the check came. I can go to five  guys and get a great burger with plenty of fries.

Very disappointed.  Came here for lunch yesterday and food was terrible and overpriced.  We ordered some burger which came with steak cut fries.  Burger was soooo small and did not look good at all, and there were literally only a few fries that came with the burger...not worth $11 dollars whatsoever.  We also got the boneless buffalo bites, that was terribly dry as well.  The chips it came with were all literally overcook/overfried!  Nothing was pleasing.  We left very unsatisfied.  I would not recommend anyone coming here! Oh, also, our waitress was such a ditz.  She didnt know anything about the menu and couldnt answer my questions.  She also gave our bill to another table.  This place is a disaster and so unorganized.

I think this will be my last visit to this location.  Every Time I have come here there is always a wait... Here's the great part there is hardly anyone in the restaurant.  It seems like they are always operating on a skeleton crew.  Never once have we been seated upon arrival.  The service is always slow as well.

I've been going to Red Robin since I was in high school which was, ahem, well, never mind, the point being that I have had a chance to experience a few years of what Red Robin has to offer. My favorite and go to meal has always been the bottomless fries and the chicken clucks. Me and my best friend would basically go to Red Robin order one each and just sit there and gab and pretend like we were grown ups going to a "grown up" restaurant. To this day I still order the clucks and fries. I think I've had maybe one burger and it was the black and bleu and it was pretty darn delicious. I could probably just eat the fries truth be told. The beers are good here too and the service has always been great. I like that it is a family friendly place, but there are spaces for more "adult" oriented dining too. Great for the whole family.

My boyfriend and  I love to enjoy dinner and beer here and so far we've been lucky enough to have Natalie as our waitress a couple of times. I must say every single time we've had the pleasure of having Natalie as our waitress we've been more than satisfied with our service. She's awesome and always has a great attitude! Always going above and beyond and gives us excellent customer service!! :)

Nothing bad to say. Had pleasant experience, been coming here for a bit with my bf and we looovveee the turkey burger, considering he's a regular burger type of guy, and we loooveeee the steak fries. Need i say more?

We spent 47.00 on a lunch we   not what I remember. My salad came on this rectangular plate that was unable to hold my salad so things kept falling off the plate. The other salads that came to our table had uncut chicken that tasted like a tire and had no knife to cut it with, salad dressing that had no taste and was barely noticeable. We ordered fries as an appetizer and the waiter brought out 7 fries...7...for 3 people. Apparently we look like 3 supper models trying to share 1 m&m....the waiter then tried to tell us that she wasn't trying to rip us off but that was the new serving size...to add to all of this when she would come to the table (like 2 times) she awkwardly leaned over us.......needless to say the best part of the meal was being able to pay on the electronic pad at the table so we could get the hell out.

I am very upset at the lack of unprofessional at this restaurant i wish I can give it a "no starts" but one is fine or -1 star .. (Watch out everyone the manager might tell the server to go home and she would have to close you out ) a little more help from Brian would have been nice ! Il definitely go online as well.

Very disappointed. Ordered a $15. "SPECIALTY" burger with bottomless fries. I've had bigger patties on a jr. Burger supposed to be 1/3 lb. Bottomless fries sure there's no bottom to the cup they come in. But asked for a refill and I was already done my meal by the time they arrived 20+ minutes. Same with the drink strawberry lemonade the waitress took 20 minutes to refill my glass. We have always liked this location and have been here many times but never again.
Every single time I come here, I get excellent service.  Awesome service. My husband and I like coming here for that reason. Spending our hard earned money wisely!
Absolutely my favorite red robin location. The staff is very welcoming. Erica, the hostess is amazing and the food taste great. I really recommend the blue moon beer shake.
After being seated we realized we were stepping on about half a sandwich that was left over from the table before us. Waitress never even acknowledged the mess.
Waitress forgot to bring our drinks, had to ask for them. When burgers were finally out they were cold. Bad service. Food would have been delicious if it wasn't cold

My boyfriend and I went to this location for his bday and we couldn't be more than pleased our server David guessed we were first timers and guided us through the menu he also kept the fries and drinks going! I got the bonzai (it had pineapple and teriyaki sauce) burger and my boyfriend ordered the guacamole burger both were tasty and beyond your average burger! Definitely recommend this location service is fast and friendly.

Great food! Great service! I had a Royal Burger, which came with a fried egg on top. I should have ordered it with a different cheese (it comes with American), but I wanted to try it in is original incarnation the first time. It had bacon, lettuce, tomato, mayo, and the burger. Filling! I took half home for lunch tomorrow. Health friendly option: bottomless broccoli side, in place of bottomless fries Fun (for me, at least) friendly option: milkshake with Kahlua, aka "boozy shake". Yum! We signed up for their club, right at the little machine on the table. Once you accumulate 9 entrees, you will get the 10th free. Plus, my guy will get a free burger on his bday. Our waitress, Natalie, was there every time we needed something, and not overbearing when we didn't. She was friendly, too, and efficient. Not much to complain about here, except a couple of crying babies which my confirmed bachelor boyfriend gets a little edgy over. But, their parents were on alert, and rocked them or fed them to keep the screams from becoming ear piercing. (I'm a mom myself, so I do sympathize.) We'll be back!

Horrible. 15 minutes to get seated is no big deal. But then we sat at our table for 15 minutes, called the server on the iPad twice and nobody came over. For having so many servers, nobody was doing anything. Poorly run. Might want to think about re-staffing
I am a frequent customer and absolutely love this location. I always get seated quickly, the food is always great and the service is always wonderful!

Wonderful lunch.  I just had a salad and ice tea.  I have been a little disappointed with this chain lately, but this location reminded me of why I like Red Robbin. Delicious fresh food, served quickly and tastes great.  Exactly what I would want and expect from a casual family restaurant.  Keep up the great work and hopefully the other locations will improve to the standards of this location.

Have been coming here since we moved to this area a few years ago. Good food and service. Have a rewards card which is a great deal and love that they have a variety on their menu. I usually customize my burger and I love the bottomless fries.
Always go to this location. Always great food and service for how slammed busy they are all the time. Weird to see all the poor reviews!

Don't eat here often but we decided to go for lunch.What a pleasant surprise!! Food was Very good service was OK for this type of chain restaurant. I had a burger and fries that were fantastic and a great value. I cant imagine going to carl's jr and spending $10-12 on a combo when you can have a sit down experience at red robin for$ 9-11. Just go at non peak hours and the wait time is basically a non issue.

I love their food the fries are my favorite not to mention the strawberry lemonade yumm! I just hope next time I go my server is checking on us if we need anything ? Only came to give us the check when I was actually waiting for a refill for drink, fries and ranch

Blah! This is their 3rd strike with us.  Ordered my son a CHEESEburger to go tonight hubby told the guy over the phone plain cheeseburger with American cheese.  We get home and no cheese on the dang burger.  We've been here plenty of times to know that they just can't get it together.
Extremely slow service. ...we've been sitting for at least 40 minutes and still waiting for our food. Not happy!

Some of the best burgers in the area.  However, if you go on a busy night and you ask for customizations to your burger know that there is a strong likelihood that they will get it wrong the first time and sometimes even the second (which happened to me tonight).  Overall it's definitely nicer than the La Habra location which even after some renovation last year still smells like you're eating in the sewer.

Whiskey Tango Foxtrot. In what universe are you lead to your table, order (and receive) both your drinks AND your appetizer and THEN after 3-4 minutes of looking around for a waitress, summon the Asst Manager so you can get utensils AND napkins?!!?!? This is a recurring problem with this restaurant. SUGGESTION: Don't escort customers to their table without picking up napkins and silverware! They also got my order wrong. 2 stars was generous.
Excellant drinks and food. Love the kids burger I can finish it and it fillls me up. Great Doh rings and they make one if the best LA Waters I've ever had. Service is okay. Never been upset.

This location has been on a steady decline service wise for us and in my opinion has now crashed and burned. I think their food is good, not great or anything but nothing to complain about, but all that is no good if you have very bad service from your hosts and wait staff. Bad service as in; long wait to have order taken, improper food brought, no napkins, no refills, they forget or do not put in appetizer orders, they drop and break glasses near your and just walk away like it was no big deal, basically just being treated badly.  We tried to give them second chances seeing as we used to go here all the time with great results, but the last time when walked in they ignored us and it was early on a week day, so needless to say we just left and went to The Habit. Will not be returning to this Red Robin location EVER.

Went to celebrate my birthday today.  Arrived about 7-7:30. Was pretty crowded, of course for St Patricks, but didn't have to wait long.  We were seated in the bar. Food took a  long time.  However,  two tables that came after us received their food before us.  When the food finally came the fries were cold and the burgers were luke warm.  Clearly the food was sitting a while. I'm sure the burger would have tasted alot better had it been served hot. Overall a very disappointing birthday night out.  :(

Every time we ho to this location , theres a ten minute wait , and plenty of open tables inside . The burgers are good , but not great . My order came out with 11 fries on my plate . Thats right , 11 . We requested more fries right away . No drink refill until 20 minutes passed . Finished our food , still no more fries . These are supossed to be bottomless here people ! Waitress brings out a wimpy basket of fries about 20 this time for 2 people . This was not rush hour either . 2:30 pm and this kind of service is unacceptable . How long does it take to make fries ? Is there a potatoe fammon in Whittier ?

Bomb burgers! If you love spice get the burning love. The service was pretty bad. They just took our drink order and took FOREVER to bring them to us. They also do "bottomless fries" which is endless fries but they also take a while to bring them to you, and when they finally bring them it's only like 8 to 10 fries so then you have to ask for more. They are pretty friendly but the service is just SLOOOOW.

The help is usually spot on BUT don't EVER get Ryan to take your phone order. He makes you wait forever! I was on hold over 7 minutes listening to the same music and comercials over and over. When he answered the phone I told him, wow I have been waiting over 7 minuets.  He was rude and curt and then made tons of excuses- there were 7 people ahead of you. Then he was rude taking my order. I'm calling the manager tomorrow.  I always go here and site in the bar area. They are super in there!
The best fish and chips, recommending this restaurant to anyone who wants to have a birthday party or just come on hang out with the Red Robin staff.

Me and my family loved going there until yesterday.  We were seated in clear view of the bar area where everyone's drink is served. I observed quite a few things that ultimately made me lose my appetite. The bartender was wiping down counters, soda fountains with the same dirty towel then proceeded to make customers drinks without washing her hands, grabbing glasses from the rim and putting lemons/cherries on the glasses. What looked like the manager, she was refilling the ice area in the bar using buckets that she placed on the floor and proceeded to grab the bucket from the bottom and dumping the ice in the ice bin. After doing that, the proceeded to mix an alcoholic drink for a costumer in the same method as the other employee without washing her hands. The servers were also back and forth in the bar area getting sodas, juice, shakes, etc and were grabbing the holders that they put the customer bills in that everyone has grabbed/touched and they also proceeded to get glasses by the rim, grabbing the straws by the end where we all put our mouth on and were also placing lemons in certain drinks with no hand washing what so ever. I saw the bus boy cleaning tables, clearing the dirty dishes, carrying the plastic bin they put the dirty dishes in. He then proceeded to pull a paper "to go" cup to serve a drink and a stack of cups fell and instead of tossing them, he placed them back on the counter grabbing them from the rim as well. I also saw one of the servers placing an order using the touch screen, rub the whole side of her face then grab a cup and straw and gave that drink to a customer.  Will never go back here again and for those of you who enjoy going there for the great food, pay attention to how no one seems to wash their hands but touch everything.
Today its a little warm outside 72degrees, so we decided to grab a bite at Red Robin in Whittier. We did a little shopping here at Whittwood got a few bargins. We are now chill'n.

Ryan at the front is great at welcoming people when they enter. All we got was 'how many? Name?'  Jenny the server was nice and the food was egh.. the salad isn't worth 10.79. I of course had to leave early since my toddler was too loud. FYI- a 1 1/2 yr old is going to be loud she's a toddler. So please keep your rude remarks to yourself. And no I cannot control her. I will not be coming back here

Me and my family came here after receiving a gift card and free appetizer coupon from a bad experience at a Red Robin in Cerritos a few months back. All I can say is that this place is average good service the bonsai burger I always get was good the kids like their food nothing to complain about I give it 3 stars because that's the highest I give to a big chain restaurant that is serving what they supposed to and taste the way is supposed to, I reserve the 4 and 5 stars to restaurants that serve specialty dishes or one of a kind authentic dishes, dishes that kick my tongue across my mouth in a good delicious way.

Well we came in to use a gift card that was given to me from a manager in red robin because I had a bad experience about a week ago.. And everything was going good until The lady who I thought was our waitress said we were getting a new waitress and she was just there to take our drink order and we snuck in an appetizer order. Our new waitress was so slow and with a toddler it's sort of hard to just wait around when all the food is gone just to get our check. It got to the point where we had to speak to a manager and she offered to give us a discount but we refused because we come here often and the food was hot and our drinks were cold and those few items came out of the kitchen quick, it was just our waitress that was a little behind on checking up on us and refilling our basket of fries.

Restaurant is super busy on Friday nights. Came in as a party of seven, waited 30+ minutes on food and fries and refills took forever. Love the place food was great just really slow service maybe understaffed.

So why five stars for a Red Robin? Because every single time I come here, the food is great, service is great, drinks are great, and the atmosphere is great. I live across the street, so I literally walk here with the family and we can sit on the patio with drinks, and watch the sun go down. This might not apply to every location, but it does this one. Try the wedge salad, buffalo tenders, and French dip. Anything really, but those you can't go wrong with.

So disappointed this time. Our waitress Kristen must be new. she took our drink orders, got two wrong, then we waited a while for the other 2 because they were from the bar. Ok. When we placed our order she asked the first person again what they'll be having. I said she already ordered, and repeated it for her. Our appetizer came and we were reminiscing of a time when the chili con queso dip was enough for all four of us and when they used to bring enough chips...We finished pretty quickly and almost 45 min later still no food. No salad either. The manager came and said they were running a little behind in the kitchen. He asked if he could bring us fries. We finished the fries. My husband said she probably forgot to put our order in. We were getting ready to tell the manager we were leaving when the food finally arrived, minus my salad! It came eventually.  Mind you the food was very good but by now we are all in a bad mood after being there for over an hour. The manager gave us half off and this was the first time we left ZERO tip. I'm sure the staff that share tips were not too happy tonight. I overheard the manager also apologizing to another table and comping them something as well. This bad service is costing them money. I appreciate the manager taking care of it. We are saving our gift card for another occasion and possibly another location.

Our service was excellent today. Denise is an outstanding server. She served us with professionalism and kindness. We were never a burden to her, which is refreshing these days. The bar was pretty slammed and she handled it so well. Kudos to her! The food was also delicious! I enjoyed the chicken tortilla soup.
Your blue cheese lettuce wedge is fantastic and your promotions are great.  All your burgers are really good.  I am always surprised how good the service is here.

Been here several times with the family. Great enviornment for a family meet up. Wish they had some better beers on tap, but they do have a wide bottled selection. Food is pretty good. Make sure to ask for fries early because they only give a small portion. Fries are endless.

They wanted us to leave early so they started out with good service and then when we said we wanted a minute to order they lagged it to ask us what we wanted and we almost left until they decided to take our order right when I was about leave

Food was great but service went from 5 stars to non-existent. Then when I asked for a beer it took over 15 minutes... My original waitress completely disappeared too. Great food, horrible service.

Excellent!  My girl ordered the gourmet burger.  I got the royal red robin burger monster with avocado and ghost chili on the side.  We also got 2 pumpkin pie shakes. This Red Robin has made the grave mistake of hiring way too many young kids, and scheduling way too few managers and supervisors.  My boyfriend and I walked in, and were greeted by nobody. A young girl came out to the entrance area, smiled at us, and then walked into the kitchen. Confused, we waited a minute or so and then decided to seat ourselves in the bar, and on the way in I saw the same girl chatting in the kitchen with the staff.  We sat ourselves and waited several minutes. A young man came by and said "Here you go" and handed us some menu's, but never said if he was our waiter, WHEN our waiter would get there, or WHO it was. We pushed the "Call the Server" button. Nothing. We sat there and waited...waited....waited. Finally I suggested to my boyfriend that we sit at the bar if we EVER wanted to get service (since the bartender was the only employee in the room) and, sure enough, we were asked if we wanted drinks, what we'd like to order, etc. The bartender was not friendly, but maybe that was due to the fact that she and the chef's were the only ones in the joint actually WORKING. Throughout my visit I saw plenty of employees grouped up in little cliques chatting; from my chair I was able to see employees standing around texting in the kitchen for 10 minutes at a time; and when I left, as a nice farewell, the 2 employees leaning on the "host" stand, chatting, did not say a word as we walked out. I called out behind me "Yeah, you're welcome, have a nice day too!" Not once in my entire visit did I see one. freaking. manager. We were regular customers and would patronize this place at least once a week for who knows how many years. I don't plan to come back though after this. You are LOSING vital  local business because you're not keeping on top of these idle, super young employees who WILL stand around looking at their phones and ignoring customers if you let them.

My family and I had dinner at Red Robin on Saturday, 7/9/2016, around 5:30 and was seated within two minutes of walking in the front door. We had great service. Our dinner was on our table within 10 minutes of ordering and it tasted great (two of us had the fish and chips, one had a burger). The second round of bottomless fries was delivered to our table promptly, one had garlic fries, one had regular, and one had sweet potato fries. Our waitress was very attentive and asked if we would like our drinks refilled without us having to ask her. We had no complaints.

Went to Red Robin in Whittier with a friend on 7/15/16 at approximately 1:00pm.  Upon arrival we noticed a couple groups of people ahead of us waiting for a table. So to our surprise, the host asked us if we were 21 (Ehem! I'll take a compliment any day) and immediately sat us at the bar area.  We ordered water and an appetizer of salsa, guac, and chips. I didn't care much for the salsa but the chips and guac were yummy.   After a few minutes we finally decided on our order. I got the Whiskey Bbq Burger with a Boca patty and my friend ordered the chicken California burger.  As my friend and I chatted away and devoured the appetizer, we noticed that are food had yet to arrive. We waited a few minutes more and the waitress from the bar area told us it would be a few more minutes. So we continued to wait... And wait... And when I finally checked the time it had been about 40 minutes since we ordered. Yikes!!!!   We finally got our order and it was warm and delicious. Although my friend did point out they forgot her bacon.  I'm not a fan of bacon but I figured that for anyone that is a fan that may be a big deal. Not even a couple minutes after discussing the bacon situation, the manager comes over to apologize for the delay. He was super friendly and explained that there was a mix up with our order. He asked if there was anything we needed and I mentioned that my friend didn't get her bacon. The manager goes ahead and immediately brings her over some bacon and proceeds to tell her that her meal is taken care of! WOW!!!    So... As We finally finish our meal and my friend finishes her story about a horrible experience at an Apple Bee's in Santa Ana, our friendly waitress comes over to ask if we need anything else. She also apologizes for the delay with our food and proceeds to tell us that our entire meal was taken care of.  DOUBLE WOW!!! We definitely did not expect that.  And this is why I LOVE me some Red Robin. And yes, although the wait was long they definitely made up for it. I had to give them 5 stars for the delicious food, owning up to their mistake and making up for it with a comped meal. There is nothing stopping me now, I will continue to come back.

They demanded quality food and service and taught me great work ethic and training skills that I still use today in my job as a teacher. So it makes me so sad that here in Whittier they can't seem to get a to-go order right and that the standard is set so low. What happened? The last 6 to-go orders have been wrong, everything from forgetting items to including things that we didn't order. I think we've finally given up on this place.
Great hamburgers but a little on the pricey side. Waitress was friendly but food took awhile to come out.

Go somewhere else! Extremely disappointed with our visit Friday night. First, when we arrived the hostesses at the front counter completely ignored me. Then there was a hair in my wedge salad. Once I notified the server she brought a replacement salad AFTER my cold meal came? She went on to say the manager would take off both salads? WTF, you're gonna charge me for a replacement & hairy salad? On top of that, the replacement salad-piece of lettuce wedge-was rotten on the bottom. Do they even look at what they are serving customers??  Also, my daughter found a piece of lettuce in her FRUIT salad, why? My guess is they're so busy their food line must be all tossed up & getting mixed together.  I came to this location since the La Habra one seems to have an issue with water bugs that come out while guest are eating. Check out that review! Not sure if my biggest regret was coming here Friday or not taking pictures of the mess since I was trying to enjoy the evening with my daughter.  Oh yeah, the manager did give a $3 discount for the salad which cost $5. No consistency here, in their food or word.

Have been going to this Red Robin for many years, recently noticed the place is becoming a little more and more dingy and dirty, staff does not seem to be wiping down walls doors, noticed a lot of greasy fingerprints all over the place, our table was dirty, the touchscreen devices on a table were extremely dirty and need to be wiped down, fingerprints from many customers, one can only imagine all the goop on there from other people.

So i am all about cool technology at tables but not when you are spending $14 for a burger.  Server never comes back. You order refills and pay check from the tablet at the table. All fine  and good if you want to be ignored. Even at a "fast Food" place  like The Habit they come and check on you at your table.  Food was meh.  Took us 15 min to be seated at 4:30 pm with the restaurant 3/4 empty.   They need to rethink their strategy.  Oh and the bathrooms were yuck.

It was my first time to any Red Robin's I was looking forward to a good burger BUT what I ordered and was I got was different. Asked for medium well got burn hidden under a bed of yummy mushrooms bun was dry and fry's were cold not going back. To the one BUT the sweet tea was the bomb
This location is head and shoulders ahead of the dump in La Habra. Good service, clean restaurant, and friendly employees.

I am usually a big fan of Red Robin, but this location always seems to leave me wondering why I come back. On my last visit, we stopped by around 8 pm on a week day. The restaurant was pretty empty except for the MNF crowd at the bar and a few tables in the dining area, so it was not busy for sure. We started off with some fried pickles and our drinks (this is always our order). The pickles and drinks came out, the pickles were looking like chocolate. They were super burnt, that even the ring around the pickle on the inside was black. Shortly after our food came out, everything was spot on about our order. All the special requests were accommodated. We asked the young girl who brought out our food for refills as our waiter had not came back to our table to see if we needed anything. After she came back with the refills our waiter still never stopped by again. Not even to offer more fries, because c'mon who eats only one basket of fries at RR? Overall, besides our pickles the food was spot on RR goodness. The service was really non-existent which made the dining experience a little rough per se. We'll just stick with the other RR in the area and probably just skip this one for a while.

I ordered through door dash and I must say door dash was great but Red Robin sucked! My burger buns were soggy soaked in dressing and my sandwich bun was burned. My soup was less than half full and the quality of food was just not worth the price at all, I was very unsatisfied.

Bleu cheese burger and sweet potato fries were delicious.  The party tasted like beef.  My husband loved his traditional burger and my son the grilled avacodo bacon burger.  I also like they have a nutrition pamphlet of their entire menu to help make better informed decision on which meal to enjoy.  Great service.
